text: Mi Sandi () (born 12 June 1990) is a Burmese singer. == Early life and education == Mi Sandi was born on 8 June 1990 in Yangon, Myanmar. She graduated from International Management College in 2010 with a Bachelor of Business Management (BBM). She received a diploma in Accounting and Management Accounting from LCCI (UK) in 2011, and a Master of Business Management (MBA) in 2014. == Career == She gained popularity with the song "Frozen smile" (ရေခဲရိုက်အပြုံး) which she performed alongside G Fatt in 2017. The crossover between the two fanbases was hugely successful. In 2013, she sang the song "Ma Nyo Nyin Yat Bu", featuring singer Yair Yint Aung.https://www.myanmarcelecrazy.com/%E1%80%80%E1%80%BB%E1%80%B1%E1%80%AC%E1%80%84%E1%80%BA%E1%80%B8%E1%80%90%E1%80%AF%E1%80%94%E1%80%BA%E1%80%B8%E1%80%80%E1%80%85%E1%80%AC%E1%80%82%E1%80%BB%E1%80%95%E1%80%AD%E1%80%AF%E1%80%B8-%E1%80%95/ On 27 September 2017, energy drink M-150. Official page on Mi Sandi G Fatt (); Song MTV. After one hour, there were more than 20,000 shares and over 500,000 views. Today there are over 1.8 million views. == Honours and awards == *Special Music Award of the Monsoon 2014 *The Best Selling Studio Music Album Female Vocalist of the Year 2018(City FM). == Discography == === Solo albums === *Monopoly () (2013) *Pyitt Taing Htaung () (2014) *A Thae Lay () (2017) *That Ti Khae () (2019) === Single albums === *Chit Chan Myar Swar Phyint () (2015) *Kaung Own Lay () (2016) *Brainless () (2018) *Moe Mi Mar Soe Tal () (2018) *Empty Pocket () (2018) *High-5 () (2018) *I would () (2019) *Competition () (2019) *Do it all again () (2019) *Falling Hard () (2019) *A Thae Kwal A Pay A Tay () (2019) == References == == External links == * Category:1990 births Category:Living people Category:Burmese female models Category:Burmese female rappers Category:Burmese female singers Category:Burmese film actresses Category:Burmese singer-songwriters Category:Burmese Theravada Buddhists Category:Burmese-language singers Category:People from Yangon
